full.title: Version
full.description: Json schema version for the vEnvironment configuration file. Acceptance criteria: equal major version, less/equal minor and patch version.

full.title: Include files
full.description: Include a different file (similar to #include of the c preprocessor). The order of includes does not matter. Circular / multiple includes are resolved correctly.

full.title: Scenarios
full.description: List of scenarios with the option to define / override variables or defines.

full.title: Variables
full.description: List of variables to be used in this configuration file.

full.title: Defines
full.description: List of defines to be passed to capl / vcdl. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Global Settings
full.description: Global settings for all scenarios.

database-dotnet-namespace-generation.description: User defined settings for namespace generation in the .Net typelib. Default complies with the setting "Automatic Qualification". With this setting the namespaces for signals are automatically generated so that each class is unique. For each frame a class is generated in the namespace "NetworkDB.Frames".

time-scaling-factor.description:
'number': The measurement is slowed-down by this factor. For scaling factors between zero and one, the simulation is accelerated accordingly. For example, if you enter the value 0.1 the measurement is accelerated by a factor of 10. 
'as-fast-as-possible': Run the simulation as fast as possible. The simulation speed is not constant and depends on the performance of the computer and the load that is provoked by simulation.

time-source.description:
Time source for the simulation. Operate without hardware and simulate all buses completely. 
'internal-realtime': The time response of the measurement (time basis) is controlled internally. 
'external-software': The time response of the measurement (time basis) is controlled by an external program. 
'internal-scaled': The simulation speed is provided through the property time-scaling-factor.

full.title: System Variables
full.description: A lists of system variables to be used by the simulation. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Databases
full.description: List of databases. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: CAN Networks
full.description: List of CAN networks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: CANFD Networks
full.description: List of CANFD networks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: CAN Networks
full.description: List of Ethernet networks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: FlexRay Clusters
full.description: List of FlexRay clusters. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: LIN Networks
full.description: List of LIN networks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Simulation Nodes
full.description: A list of simulation nodes used in a simulation. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Datasources
full.description: The definition of datasources used by application models. Input files can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Application Models
full.description: List of application models representing some program. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Programming Modules
full.description: Lists of programming modules to be used by the simulation. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: User Files
full.description: List of user files. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: XCP files
full.description: List of XCP configuration files (entries can be deactivated with when)

full.title: FDX
full.description: FDX settings. Entry can be deactivated with when.

transport-layer.description: Protocol to be used as transport layer for the FDX protocol

port.description: Number of the UDP or TCP port to be used for the FDX protocol

description-files.description: List of XML files that describe which signals or variables are to be exchanged and the manner in which this is to occur (e.g., with regard to grouping). Each entry can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Functional mockup units
full.description: List of functional mockup units. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: SIL Kit
full.description: SIL Kit settings. Entry can be deactivated with when.

participant-name.description: Name used by the simulation tool to join a simulation as a participant at the start of a measurement.

simulation-step-in-micro-sec.description: Time length of a single simulation step. Valid only for the time-source "external-software".

life-cycle-event-timeout-in-sec.description: Maximum waiting time for the other simulation participants. Valid only for the time-source "external-software".

full.title: Logging Block
full.description: Configuration of the logging for the environment.

full.title: CAN Replay Blocks
full.description: List of CAN replay blocks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Ethernet Replay Blocks
full.description: List of ethernet replay blocks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: LIN Replay Blocks
full.description: List of LIN replay blocks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

'internal-scaled': The simulation speed is provided through the property time-scaling-factor.

full.title: Scenarios
full.description: List of scenarios with the option to define / override variables or defines.

full.title: Scenario
full.description: A scenario with the option to define / override variables or defines.

name.description: A C-identifier for this variable (case sensitive).

from-environment.description: Take the value from a system environment variable.

full.title: Variable
full.description: This variable can be used in any other node and overwritten by a scenario.
full.$comment: has to be split, since the type determines the valid values

oneOf.description: Variable of type implicit type (string, number or bool).
Variable of type string or path.

full.title: Define
full.description: Defines to be passed to capl / vcdl.

access-mode.description: Mode of the underlying Ethernet bus. Classic approach is the 'Channel-based' setup.       More recent and recommended mode is the switched 'Network-based' mode (port based).

signal-updates.description: Specifies how signals are updated on Network-based access. Will be ignored on Channel-based setups. Always: Events of all ports are used to update a signal without qualified ethernet port. rx-only: Only packets received by the interface are used, which leads to less duplicated updates. never: Signals without qualified ethernet ports are not updated.

anyOf.description: Events of all ports are used to update a signal without qualified ethernet port.
Only packets received by the interface are used, which leads to less duplicated updates.
Signals without qualified ethernet ports are not updated.

full.title: Global settings for FlexRay
full.description: These settings control the interpretation of frames and PDUs of FlexRay configurations with channels A and B.

enable-dual-channel-support.description: If active, PDUs on both channels will be configured with channel mask 'AB' and channel postfixes (e.g. xy_Ch_A, xy_Ch_B) will be created for ambiguous objects.

postfixes-for-ambiguous-pdus-on-channel.description: Definition of postfix settings if dual channel support is not activated.

autosar-pdu-layer.description:
Configure the PDU layer in relation to AUTOSAR databases.
'no-pdus' : Creation of frames only 
'from-autosar-4.0' : Creation of AUTOSAR PDUs for AUTOSAR DBs >= 4.0 
'from-autosar-4.2' : Creation of AUTOSAR PDUs for AUTOSAR DBs >= 4.2

autosar-text-table-entries.description: Control naming of text table entries and influence signal qualification. Use text from COMPU-CONST nodes or SHORT-LABEL nodes.

some-ip-pdus-without-service-context.description: Control the generation of services for SOME/IP PDUs without service context.

full.title: System variables
full.description: Absolute or relative path to an external file containing system variables. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.

full.title: Database
full.description: Absolute or relative path to an external database file (.dbc / .ldf / ...). Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.

network-name.description: Select a network from the database (cluster name if .arxml). If selected, 'name' must match 'network-name'.

full.title: CAN network
full.description: A Network using the CAN protocol taking part in a simulation.

baudrate.description:
Baudrate of this CAN bus. 
 If this value is set, it has priority. 
 If this value is not set, the baudrate is read from the database. If the baudrate is missing from the database, the default value is used.

application-channel.description: Index of the application channel. Each bus type should provide consecutive indices. Starts counting at 1. Value between 1 and 255. Value '0' is not allowed. Caution: CAN and CANFD share the application channels!

full.title: CANFD network
full.description: A Network using the CANFD protocol taking part in a simulation.

mode.description: Operation Mode setting (iso or non-iso Mode).

arbitration-baudrate.description:
Baudrate for the arbitration phase of CAN FD in Baud. 
 If this value is set, it has priority. 
 If this value is not set, the baudrate is read from the database. If the baudrate is missing from the database, the default value is used.

data-baudrate.description:
Baudrate for the data phase of CAN FD. 
 If this value is set, it has priority. 
 If this value is not set, the baudrate is read from the database. If the baudrate is missing from the database, the default value is used.

application-channel.description: Index of the application channel. Each bus type should provide consecutive indices. Starts counting at 1. Value between 1 and 255. Value '0' is not allowed. Caution: CAN and CANFD share the application channels!

full.title: Ethernet network
full.description: A Network using the Ethernet protocol taking part in a simulation.

application-channel.description: Index of the application channel. Each bus type should provide consecutive indices. Starts counting at 1. Value between 1 and 32. Value '0' is not allowed.

full.title: FlexRay cluster
full.description: A cluster using the FlexRay protocol taking part in a simulation.

application-channel.description: Index of the Application Channel. Each bus type should provide consecutive indices. Starts counting at 1. Value between 1 and 32. Value '0' is not allowed.

full.title: LIN network
full.description: A network using the LIN protocol taking part in a simulation.

application-channel.description: Index of the application channel. Each bus type should provide consecutive indices. Starts counting at 1. Value between 1 and 64. Value '0' is not allowed.

mode.description: Working mode of the LIN interface.

anyOf.description: The LIN network interface is able to output message headers on the network.
The LIN network interface responds to received LIN headers if a response to the LIN ID contained within the header has been configured.

full.title: Simulation Node
full.description: Represents a simulation node used in a simulation

database-node.description: Use to assign explicitely a database node to a simulation node. If not set, the simulation-node name will be used as database-node. To deactivate automatic assignement, it should be set to false.

modeling-libraries.description: For assignment of modeling libraries to this simulation node.

full.description: Declares when to add this node.

anyOf.$comment: impossible to express this grammar as a regex

full.description: List of defines to be passed to capl / vcdl.

full.title: Application Model
full.description: Represents an application used in a scenario

full.title: Programming modules
full.description: Programming modules file paths (capl-library or c-library). Entry can be deactivated with when.

full.title: User files
full.description: Absolute or relative path to user files that can be read/written by CAPL/.NET Scripts. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.

full.title: XCP files
full.description: Absolute or relative path to an external xcpcfg file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a FDX description file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.

active-model-variables.description: List of the FMU variables which should be exported

inactive-model-variables.description: List of the FMU variables which should be excluded from the export

full.title: Functional mockup unit
full.description: Represents a functional mockup unit used in a scenario.
Absolute or relative path to a SIL Kit config file (.yaml or .json). Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Name of a blf file, supporting the field codes: {ComputerName}, {LocalTime}, {MeasurementIndex}, {MeasurementStart}, {IncSize|001|100MB} and {IncTime|001|01h00m}.
Advanced logging configurations.

full.title: CAN replay block
full.description: A replay block for the CAN protocol.

full.title: Ethernet replay block
full.description: A replay block for the ethernet protocol.

full.title: LIN replay block
full.description: A replay block for the LIN protocol.

replay-mode.description:
Select events to be replayed. 
'all-responses': replay all the responses.
'master-responses-only': replay the responses only for frames published by the Master node.
'master-requests-only': replay only 0x3c responses.
'no-headers': disable replay of the LIN frame headers.

send-events.description:
Select which events from rx-responses, tx-responses and wakeup-signals are replayed. If not set, the default value depends on the value of replay-mode.
 For 'all-responses' or 'master-responses-only': all events are sent.
 For 'master-requests-only': only wakeup-events are sent.
 For 'no-headers': none of the events are sent.

autosar-pdu-layer.description:
Configure the PDU layer in relation to AUTOSAR databases.
'no-pdus' : Creation of frames only 
'from-autosar-4.0' : Creation of AUTOSAR PDUs for AUTOSAR DBs >= 4.0 
'from-autosar-4.2' : Creation of AUTOSAR PDUs for AUTOSAR DBs >= 4.2

autosar-text-table-entries.description: Control naming of text table entries and influence signal qualification. Use text from COMPU-CONST nodes or SHORT-LABEL nodes.

full.title: Simulation Node
full.description: Represents a simulation node used in a simulation

database-node.description: Use to assign explicitely a database node to a simulation node. If not set, the simulation-node name will be used as database-node. To deactivate automatic assignement, it should be set to false.

modeling-libraries.description: For assignment of modeling libraries to this simulation node.

full.title: Scenario
full.description: A scenario with the option to define / override variables or defines
Define to be passed to capl / vcdl.
Global configuration for the TCP/IP stack.

selected-stack.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided

anyOf.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. (use 'canoe' if settings should be manually provided)

selected-stack.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided

anyOf.description: If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided. (remove other elements for option operating-system)

full.description: Absolute or relative path to a vsysvar file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
A C-identifier for this element (case sensitive)
Absolute or relative path to an external database file (.arxml/.dbc/.ldf). Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the YAML configuration file.
Define the mapping of application channels to an underlying layer.

anyOf.description: Connect application channel to simulated network.
Connect application channel to SIL Kit.

full.description: Address configuration for an TCP/IP stack.
Via the key slot configuration it is possible to transmit two start-up/sync frames. Thus an external start-up node is not required for the start-up of a flexray cluster.
Absolute or relative path to a source file of a simulation node. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
List of networks represented by this application.
Absolute or relative path to a vmodule modeling library. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Simulation node configuration for the TCP/IP stack.

selected-stack.description:
If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used.
 If set to canoe, the configuration on the global level is used (this requires globals-settings/ethernet/tcp-ip-stack/selected-stack to be set to canoe).
 If set to individual, a custom configuration can be provided

If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used.
 If set to canoe, the configuration on the global level is used (this requires globals-settings/ethernet/tcp-ip-stack/selected-stack to be set to canoe).
 If set to individual, a custom configuration can be provided

full.description: Reference to external datasource files (.vcdl/.vcodm). Absolute or relative path. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a source file of an application model (can/canencr/cs/sln/py/vmodule). Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a vmodule file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a xcpcfg file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a YAML file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a source file of a functional mockup unit (.fmu). Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a replay file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.

full.title: Timing conditions
full.description: Timing conditions for a replay block.

condition.description: The condition when the replay shall start.

anyOf.description: The first event of the replayed file occurs with measurement start.
The original timestamp of the replayed file are used.
The first event is delayed. Can be configured by the 'delayed-ms' element.

delay-ms.description: The delay in ms if the condition 'delayed' is selected. No effect otherwise.

full.title: Channel mapping
full.description: The channel mapping for a replay block.

default-mapping.description: The default mapping of a channel if it is not explicitely mapped.

anyOf.description: The channel is mapped to itself if there is an active network.
The channels are ignored by default.

mappings.title: Explicit mappings
mappings.description: The explicitly mapped channels. Overwrites the default mapping for the source.

anyOf.title: Map source channel
anyOf.description: Mapping from application channel of the replay file to a target network.

source-channel.description: The source application channel from the replayed file.

anyOf.title: Map source network
anyOf.description: Mapping from a named source network of the replay file to a named target network.

source-network.description: The source network name. Only works if the replay file was created by CANoe and contains the relevant metadata.

anyOf.title: Ignore source channel
anyOf.description: Ignores an application channel of the replay file.

anyOf.title: Ignore source network
anyOf.description: Ignores a named source network of the replay file.

ignore-source-network.description: The ignored source network name. Only works if the replay file was created by CANoe and contains the relevant metadata.

full.description: Absolute or relative path to a vmodule file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Global configuration for the TCP/IP stack.

selected-stack.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided

anyOf.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. (use 'canoe' if settings should be manually provided)

selected-stack.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided

anyOf.description: If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided. (remove other elements for option operating-system)

full.description: Absolute or relative path to a source file of an application model (can/cs/sln/py/vmodule). Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a source file of a simulation node.  Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
List of network nodes represented by this application
Simulation node configuration for the TCP/IP stack.

selected-stack.description:
If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used.
 If set to canoe, the configuration on the global level is used (this requires globals-settings/ethernet-settings/tcp-ip-stack/selected-stack to be set to canoe).
 If set to individual, a custom configuration can be provided

If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used.
 If set to canoe, the configuration on the global level is used (this requires globals-settings/ethernet-settings/tcp-ip-stack/selected-stack to be set to canoe).
 If set to individual, a custom configuration can be provided

full.description: A list of C-identifiers for referenced elements (case sensitive)
Define the mapping of application channels to an underlying layer

anyOf.description: Connect application channel to simulated network.
Connect application channel to SIL Kit.

full.title: Timing conditions
full.description: Timing conditions for a replay block.

condition.description: The condition when the replay shall start.

anyOf.description: The first event of the replayed file occurs with measurement start.
The original timestamp of the replayed file are used.
The first event is delayed. Can be configured by the 'delayed-ms' element.

delay-ms.description: The delay in ms if the condition 'delayed' is selected. No effect otherwise.

full.title: Channel mapping
full.description: The channel mapping for a replay block.

default-mapping.description: The default mapping of a channel if it is not explicitely mapped.

anyOf.description: The channel is mapped to itself if there is an active network.
The channels are ignored by default.

mappings.title: Explicit mappings
mappings.description: The explicitly mapped channels. Overwrites the default mapping for the source.

anyOf.title: Map source channel
anyOf.description: Mapping from application channel of the replay file to a target network.

source-channel.description: The source application channel from the replayed file.

anyOf.title: Map source network
anyOf.description: Mapping from a named source network of the replay file to a named target network.

source-network.description: The source network name. Only works if the replay file was created by CANoe and contains the relevant metadata.

anyOf.title: Ignore source channel
anyOf.description: Ignores an application channel of the replay file.

anyOf.title: Ignore source network
anyOf.description: Ignores a named source network of the replay file.

ignore-source-network.description: The ignored source network name. Only works if the replay file was created by CANoe and contains the relevant metadata.

address-configuration.description: Defines how the addresses are configured. Use 'static' to configure them manually with the 'addresses' property or use 'dhcp' for automatic configuration.
Defines how the addresses are configured. Use 'static' to configure them manually with the 'addresses' property or use 'dhcp' for automatic configuration.

full.description: Configurations for IPv6.

address-configuration.description: Defines how the addresses are configured. Use 'static' to configure them manually with the 'addresses' property or use 'dhcp' for automatic configuration.
Defines how the addresses are configured. Use 'static' to configure them manually with the 'addresses' property or use 'dhcp' for automatic configuration.

vlan-settings.description: Defines a VLAN with its relevant seetings.

id.$comment: reason for 4094: see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.1Q - VLAN identifier (VID)

full.description: A list of VLANs with their relevant seetings.
Configuration of a key slot node.

mode.description:
Key slot operating modes. 
'automatic': The key slot is possibly active. Any active frame in the Tx buffer will be selected for this key slot, if marked as start-up and/or sync frame. 
'off': The key slot is not used. 
'manual': Explicity definition of the key slot properties.

usage.description: The frame in this slot can be send as start-up or only as sync frame.

slot.description: Explicit slot number of the static segment that will be used as the key slot.

mask.description: Explicit channel mask used for the key slot.

leading-cold-start.description: If deactivated the key slot can only act as a following start-up or integrating sync frame.
